title.native: 劇場版 NARUTO -ナルト- 大活劇!雪姫忍法帖だってばよ!!
title.romaji: NARUTO: Dai Katsugeki! Yuki Hime Ninpouchou Dattebayo!!
title.english: Naruto the Movie: Ninja Clash in the Land of Snow

description:
Kakashi orders Naruto, Sasuke, and Sakura to watch a movie before their next mission. Naruto is a big fan of the lead actress. After the movie, they see the heroine in person and being chased. They help her and Naruto asks for an autograph but she wouldn't give him one. When the three returns, Kakashi tells them about their mission: to escort the actress to the Snow Country to film a new movie.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: NARUTO: Dai Katsugeki! Yuki Hime Shinobu Houjou Dattebayo!!
Naruto: It's the Snow Princess' Ninja Art Book!
Naruto la película: ¡Batalla ninja en la tierra de la nieve!
Naruto Movie 01: La primavera nel Paese della neve

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

title.native: 木ノ葉の里と大うん動会
劇場版 NARUTO 大活劇！ 雪姫忍法帖だってばよ!!

node.description: Masashi Kishimoto is a Japanese manga artist, well known for creating the manga series [Naruto](https://anilist.co/manga/30011/Naruto/). His younger twin brother, [Seishi Kishimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96897/Seishi-Kishimoto), is also a manga artist and creator of the manga series [666 Satan](https://anilist.co/manga/30032/OParts-Hunter/) and [Blazer Drive](https://anilist.co/manga/36612/Blazer-Drive/). He is good friends with [Eiichirou Oda](https://anilist.co/staff/96881/Eiichirou-Oda)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡村天斎) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tensai_Okamura)

During his university days at Waseda University, Okamura was a part of Waseda's manga research society and together with other budding animators, produced his first independent anime there. Upon graduating from university, Okamura joined the animation production studio Madhouse as an animator through the recommendation of a friend. Lensman was the first series he worked on as an animator. The first anime movies that he worked on were Kamui no Ken and Bobby ni Kubittake. 

In 1989, he made his debut as an episode director with Yawara! and soon made his full directorial debut in 1995 with Memories. He later left Madhouse and went freelance, working on several projects along the way.

In 1991, he changed his first name from Yutaka to Tensai.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/隅沢克之)

Frequently involved with [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise), [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation), and [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/Studio-Pierrot) productions.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/805696106420060160) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/78JmbZfna6DOfhSoxccZZw)

Masuda is perhaps best known as the composer of the 2002 hit anime series [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) where he combined traditional instruments like the shamisen and shakuhachi together with guitar, drums, bass, piano and other keyboard instruments along with chanting. Masuda also created the scores for titles such as [Mushishi](https://anilist.co/anime/457/), [Kamisama Kiss](https://anilist.co/anime/14713/) and [Ghost Hunt](https://anilist.co/anime/1571/).
Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/) where he studied under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/snjaramaki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/荒牧伸志) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinji_Aramaki)

Aramaki is one of the leading figures in the industry's CG animation, and is noted for his various design works in numerous anime series such as [Gasaraki](https://anilist.co/anime/782/), [Witch Hunter Robin](https://anilist.co/anime/7/), [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/) and [Soul Eater](https://anilist.co/anime/3588/) among many others.

Influenced by [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/1650/), [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/), and Star Wars during his junior and senior high school years, he decided to pursue a career in film. One of his first representative works was an independently produced animation titled "Moonstruck Artemis," that he made while part of a manga club during his university days. Aramaki didn't have a special desire to work in the animation industry, but has stated joining it solely because he could draw and the industry had a wide range of options for someone like that. He has also said that the spread of digital technology has made it easier for him to work in both anime and live-action.

In 2004, Aramaki directed [Appleseed](https://anilist.co/anime/54/), a re-interpretation of a [Shirou Masamune](https://anilist.co/staff/97609/) manga by [the same name](https://anilist.co/manga/30668/). Although bashed by critics, the movie was an influential piece in the medium that had great impact on creators around the world. Studio Ghibli co-founder [Toshio Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101638/) said the movie would reform the industry.

Affiliated with [Studio Silver](https://anilist.co/studio/6240/).

He is known for his sense of timing, which gives his animation often a stop-motion like feeling. He studied as an animator under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/), under whom he often worked on productions like [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) or [You're Under Arrest](https://anilist.co/anime/1372/). He does also team up often with animator [Hirofumi Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101188/), who has influenced Matsutake's animation.

Aside of working on anime he has also worked on several games, mostly the Tales of series, where he served as animation supervisor on the animated sequences in most of the series' games.

Also close friends with [Atsushi Wakabayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105805/), [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yasunoriebina)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/本田雄)

After dropping out from Tokyo Designers' College in 1987, Honda joined Atelier Giga. He later joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/), where he debuted as the studio's youngest animation director on [Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water](https://anilist.co/anime/1251/). A few years later in 1994, he got to handle the character designs for the first time on [Metal Fighter Miku](https://anilist.co/anime/1175/), a TV series directed by [Akiyuki Shinbou](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/).

After having left Gainax, Honda participated in most of [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/)'s works. Perhaps most notably as a character designer on [Millenium Actress](https://anilist.co/anime/1033/), a role which was originally planned to be [Hideki Hamasu](https://anilist.co/staff/125820/)'s, but was given to him due to Hamasu having contracted a severe tendon inflammation. Honda also designed the characters for [Mitsuo Iso](https://anilist.co/staff/100151/)'s [Dennou Coil](https://anilist.co/anime/2164/).

In 2006, Honda joined [Studio Khara](https://anilist.co/studio/47/) and reprised his vital staff roles in the [Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/2759/) franchise. The same year he made his long-awaited debut in a [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/) film, working as a key animator on [Tales from Earthsea](https://anilist.co/anime/1829/) and then again on [Ponyo](https://anilist.co/anime/2890/). His work received high praise by [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/) for expressing the characters' individuality through their movements.

Nicknamed as "Master" (師匠, Shishou), by [Takahiro Kishida](https://anilist.co/staff/101403/) during the production of [Bubblegum Crisis](https://anilist.co/anime/1347/). Since then the nickname has been widely recognized within the industry.

Nishio graduated from Nagoya Designer Academy and started his career at Anime Spot, a subcontracting studio, after being refused in interviews with several animation studios. He debuted as an in-betweener on [Osomatsu-kun](https://anilist.co/anime/9883/) and as a key animator on [Laughing Salesman](https://anilist.co/anime/3077/).

It's on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392//) that Nishio came into his own as an animator, developing weighty and realistic movements influenced by [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/). Thanks to the ability demonstrated there, he was chosen to design the characters for [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

After working as character designer and chief animation director on [Jin-Roh](https://anilist.co/anime/570/) he permanently joined Production I.G. where he became known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Kazuchika Kise](https://anilist.co/staff/115781/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

[Masashi Kishimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96879/) requested for Nishio to be the character designer of the Naruto anime.

In August 2020, he was promoted to company director of Production I.G alongside [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/Takayuki-Gotou/), a co-founder of the studio.

Nishio graduated from Nagoya Designer Academy and started his career at Anime Spot, a subcontracting studio, after being refused in interviews with several animation studios. He debuted as an in-betweener on [Osomatsu-kun](https://anilist.co/anime/9883/) and as a key animator on [Laughing Salesman](https://anilist.co/anime/3077/).

Thanks to the ability demonstrated there, he was chosen to design the characters for [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

After working as character designer and chief animation director on [Jin-Roh](https://anilist.co/anime/570/) he permanently joined Production I.G. where he became known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Kazuchika Kise](https://anilist.co/staff/115781/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

[Masashi Kishimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96879/) requested for Nishio to be the character designer of the Naruto anime.

In August 2020, he was promoted to company director of Production I.G alongside [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/Takayuki-Gotou/), a co-founder of the studio.
__Alma mater:__ Tokyo University of the Arts
__Alma mater:__ Tokyo University of the Arts

__[Website](https://www.yukiweb.net/)__

She debuted in the music industry in 1991 as the lead vocalist for the rock band [JUDY AND MARY](https://anilist.co/staff/218017), and as a solo artist in 2002.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/島村秀一)
A fast and highly regarded action animator. Friends with [Tetsuya Nishio](https://anilist.co/staff/103725/) since their junior high school days.
A fast and highly regarded action animator. Friends with [Tetsuya Nishio](https://anilist.co/staff/103725/) since their junior high school days.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/新井浩一)

One of the founders of [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jokerendcard)

Itazu joined [Studio Gallop](https://anilist.co/studio/36/) in 1998 at the young age of 18. Five years later he started a collaboration with studio [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Here he was involved in the production of the TV series [Paranoia Agent](https://anilist.co/anime/323/), which put him in touch with director [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/). After his outstanding performance in the series [Dennou Coil](https://anilist.co/anime/2164/) as a chief animation director, Kon invited him aboard the production of [The Dream Machine](https://anilist.co/anime/6585/) as character designer and chief animation director, but the project was sadly suspended when Kon passed away in 2010. Itazu eventually got to make his debut as a character designer on [Miss Hokusai](https://anilist.co/anime/20709/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/344493581)

Designer, director, and animator originally from [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11). He made his directorial debut in 2018 with [Megalo Box](https://anilist.co/anime/100298). Frequently works with [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088).

[Twitter](http://www.twitter.com/LaloGarx) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lalogarx/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/LaloGarx) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/Eduardogaara)

**José Eduardo Garza Escudero** is a Mexican voice actor. He is known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Josh Nichols in _Drake & Josh_, Elmo in _Sesame Street_ and Francis in _Malcolm in the Middle_.
He's the recurring dub voice of Josh Peck and Jonah Hill.

**Non-Anime Roles**:
* Kayn (League of Legends)
* Nightwing / Dick Grayson (Batman: Arkham Knight)
* Dirhael (Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor) 
* Delmont "Del" Walker (Gears of War 4)
* Josh Nichols (Drake & Josh)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1403759820679770114)

After graduating from Tokyo Designers' College, he joined [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/). In 1982, he made his debut as a key animator on the [Space Adventure Cobra](https://anilist.co/anime/2452/) film, and later also contributed in [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/) uncredited. He has since been wanted on many theatrical films, from [Akira](https://anilist.co/anime/47/) to most of [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/)'s films. Due to this it has been a rarity to see him show up on TV productions.

He has been called the "Legendary Effects Giant" by [Mahiro Maeda](https://anilist.co/staff/100392/).
